availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William B. Hoke (Louisville, Kentucky, attorney and notary public)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney and notary public. Kentucky native. Married to Whorten L. Hoke. Attorney in Louisville in 1860. Notary public in Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1864.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 3, page 131. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 6, page 66. Find A Grave, "William Beard Hoke (1837-1904)," Memorial #50326019, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/50326019/william-beard-hoke (accessed May 11, 2017). KYR-0001-004-1377.
